DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to determine whether dexmedetomidine is effective in the treatment of emergence deliruim after sevoflurane anesthesia in children with cerebral palsy.
DOC.brief_title: Consequence of Dexmedetomidine on Emergence Deliruim After Sevoflurane Anesthesia in Children With Cerebral Palsy
DOC.criteria: Nonquadriplegic (mono,di, hemiplegic) children with CP that are scheduled for elective Achillestendon lengthening procedure Guangzhou Women and Children's Medical Center, Guangzhou, China, with American Society of Anesthesiologists (ASA) physical status I or II. Participants that displayed symptoms of sinus bradycardia and atrioventricular block, noncommunicative severe developmental delay, seizure disorders, and treatment with seizure medications
